etymologies: early 18th century; earliest use found in John Harris (c1666–1719), writer and lecturer on science. From post-classical Latin subtangent-, subtangens from sub- + tangens

definitions: In Cartesian coordinates: the part of the x -axis lying between the two points where it is cut by the tangent at a given point on a curve and by the perpendicular drawn from that point to the x -axis.
